profile.name: BEMELINGUE Wilfried
profile.title: Computer Engineering Student specialized in AI, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning
profile.summary: Currently seeking a 6-month end-of-studies internship in Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, or Machine Learning. Based in Île-de-France, France. Fully bilingual in French and fluent in English (TOEIC in progress).

experiences.title: Intern – Data Engineer (DataFactory Team)
experiences.description:
As a DataFactory team intern at COMUTITRES (Île-de-France Mobilités), I contributed to the redesign of data processing pipelines.

Main missions:
• Migration of data processing scripts to Apache Airflow deployed on AWS
• Task automation using JSON-based workflows
• Optimization of Python scripts and SQL queries
• Design of performance indicators (KPI) for Business Intelligence
• Reinforcement of CI/CD pipelines using GitLab

This experience in an agile data environment strengthened my skills in data engineering, cloud computing, and workflow orchestration.

experiences.title: Intern – Web Application for Logistics Tracking
experiences.description:
Contributed to the enhancement and finalization of a web application for monitoring air freight logistics (import/export).

Main missions:
• Migration of the database from InterSystems Caché to InterSystems IRIS
• Development of a front-end interface for displaying logistics statistics
• Creation of REST APIs in ObjectScript and Python, directly integrated with the IRIS database
• Administration and configuration of the InterSystems IRIS server
• Migration of internal tools to next-generation technologies
• Drafting of technical documentation for internal teams and clients

experiences.title: Intern – API Interface Development
experiences.description: Participated in the development of a web application displaying air freight flows connected to a REST API. Integrated real-time data using JavaScript, improved interface usability, conducted functional tests, and contributed to technical documentation.

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.description: Arduino and mechatronics training. Designed and built a Smart Parking system and a remote-controlled car.

education.degree: Major in Smart Computing for Artificial Graphs (4th and 5th years, final year in progress, CTI accredited)
education.details: The SCIA‑G major trains engineers to design and implement artificial intelligence systems on graph-structured data. The curriculum includes advanced machine learning, graph neural networks (GNN), explainable AI (XAI), reinforcement learning, medical data processing, MLOps, stochastic modeling, and continuous optimization. The pedagogy is based on real-world projects and research-oriented challenges.

projects.title: Traffic Accident Prediction and Analysis
projects.description: Data‑viz, big data, and machine learning project analyzing and modeling accident data to detect risk factors and predict accident probability.

projects.title: TinyX Project (INFO8)
projects.description: Implementation of a microservices architecture in Java (Quarkus) using NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Neo4j), Redis messaging queues, and Kubernetes deployment.

projects.title: Differentiable Programming
projects.description: Recreation of a PyTorch‑like deep learning library to understand automatic differentiation and backpropagation mechanisms.

projects.title: Galaxy Classification
projects.description: CNN‑based image classification project using the Galaxy10‑DECals dataset to evaluate model accuracy and performance.

projects.title: NLP CV Filter
projects.description: Automated CV filtering system for recruiters using NLP and ML techniques for text parsing and scoring.

projects.title: Recommender Systems
projects.description: Implementation of collaborative filtering algorithms (ItemKNN, UserKNN, SVD) with diversification mechanisms.

projects.title: Medical ML
projects.description: Medical data classification and segmentation using MONAI and PyTorch, metric evaluation (dice score, recall).

projects.title: Explainable AI
projects.description: Evaluation of model explainability tools (SHAP, LIME) with robustness and uncertainty analysis.

projects.title: Reinforcement Learning
projects.description: Q‑learning and stochastic policy implementations for simulation environments, games, and autonomous agents.
